instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage on the top edge - Board will power cycle twice, brain dead.
threads.message:
Hello,

I have that board which had liquid damage on the top edge around CPU and would not turn on.
After fixing the L7630 area on the left of the CPU and some multiple small areas on the back, especially around Y1915,the board would fan spin and reach an S0 state with both <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> present.
However the board will fan spin twice. I've checked with a different Bios but no difference.

There are no pictures on the screen nor the backlight is present.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high.
<SIGNAL>PM_SYSRST_LIS</SIGNAL> high

<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> 3.3V

The board is like brain dead. That's not the first time I have seen that on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and I have never been able to fix these.

Any hint where else I could look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage on the top edge - Board will power cycle twice, brain dead.
threads.message:
Did you try known good working BIOS?
Board spins twice and remains on?
Liquid spill close to CPU is not good at all.
You can try to heat it with good flux.
No more than 200 degrees; no need to melt the balls, only burn evebtually accumulated crap.
Check first the voltages on the L/C blocks aligned between CPU and board edge.
Sometime one coil can be corroded, or some bad pads, solders can occur.
